1.1.desc: Ensure a separate partition for containers has been created

1.2.desc: Ensure the container host has been Hardened

1.3.desc: Ensure Docker is up to date

1.4.desc: Ensure only trusted users are allowed to control Docker daemon

1.5.desc: Ensure auditing is configured for the Docker daemon

1.6.desc: Ensure auditing is configured for Docker files and directories - /var/lib/docker

1.7.desc: Ensure auditing is configured for Docker files and directories - /etc/docker

1.8.desc: Ensure auditing is configured for Docker files and directories - docker.service

1.9.desc: Ensure auditing is configured for Docker files and directories - docker.socket

1.10.desc: Ensure auditing is configured for Docker files and directories - /etc/default/docker

1.11.desc: Ensure auditing is configured for Docker files and directories - /etc/docker/daemon.json

1.12.desc: Ensure auditing is configured for Docker files and directories - /usr/bin/docker-containerd

1.13.desc: Ensure auditing is configured for Docker files and directories - /usr/bin/docker-runc

2.1.desc: Ensure network traffic is restricted between containers on the default bridge

2.2.desc: Ensure the logging level is set to 'info'

2.3.desc: Ensure Docker is allowed to make changes to iptables

2.4.desc: Ensure insecure registries are not used

2.5.desc: Ensure aufs storage driver is not used

2.6.desc: Ensure TLS authentication for Docker daemon is configured

2.7.desc: Ensure the default ulimit is configured appropriately

2.9.desc: Ensure the default cgroup usage has been confirmed

2.10.desc: Ensure base device size is not changed until needed

2.11.desc: Ensure that authorization for Docker client commands is enabled

2.12.desc: Ensure centralized and remote logging is configured

2.13.desc: Ensure operations on legacy registry (v1) are Disabled

2.16.desc: Ensure daemon-wide custom seccomp profile is applied, if needed

2.17.desc: Ensure experimental features are avoided in production

2.18.desc: Ensure containers are restricted from acquiring new privileges

3.1.desc: Ensure that docker.service file ownership is set to root:root

3.2.desc: Ensure that docker.service file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive

3.3.desc: Ensure that docker.socket file ownership is set to root:root

3.4.desc: Ensure that docker.socket file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive

3.5.desc: Ensure that /etc/docker directory ownership is set to root:root

3.6.desc: Ensure that /etc/docker directory permissions are set to 755 or more restrictive

3.7.desc: Ensure that registry certificate file ownership is set to root:root

3.8.desc: Ensure that registry certificate file permissions are set to 444 or more restrictive

3.9.desc: Ensure that TLS CA certificate file ownership is set to root:root

3.10.desc: Ensure that TLS CA certificate file permissions are set to 444 or more restrictive

3.11.desc: Ensure that Docker server certificate file ownership is set to root:root

3.12.desc: Ensure that Docker server certificate file permissions are set to 444 or more restrictive

3.13.desc: Ensure that Docker server certificate key file ownership is set to root:root

3.14.desc: Ensure that Docker server certificate key file permissions are set to 400

3.15.desc: Ensure that Docker socket file ownership is set to root:docker

3.16.desc: Ensure that Docker socket file permissions are set to 660 or more restrictive

3.17.desc: Ensure that daemon.json file ownership is set to root:root

3.18.desc: Ensure that daemon.json file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive

3.19.desc: Ensure that /etc/default/docker file ownership is set to root:root

3.20.desc: Ensure that /etc/default/docker file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive

4.1.desc: Ensure a user for the container has been created

4.2.desc: Ensure that containers use trusted base images

4.3.desc: Ensure unnecessary packages are not installed in the container

4.4.desc: Ensure images are scanned and rebuilt to include security patches

4.5.desc: Ensure Content trust for Docker is Enabled

4.6.desc: Ensure HEALTHCHECK instructions have been added to the container image

4.7.desc: Ensure update instructions are not use alone in the Dockerfile

4.8.desc: Ensure setuid and setgid permissions are removed in the images

4.9.desc: Ensure COPY is used instead of ADD in Dockerfile

4.10.desc: Ensure secrets are not stored in Dockerfiles

4.11.desc: Ensure verified packages are only Installed

7.1.desc: Ensure swarm mode is not Enabled, if not needed

7.2.desc: Ensure the minimum number of manager nodes have been created in a swarm

7.3.desc: Ensure swarm services are binded to a specific host interface

7.4.desc: Ensure data exchanged between containers are encrypted on different nodes on the overlay network

7.5.desc: Ensure Docker's secret management commands are used for managing secrets in a Swarm cluster

7.6.desc: Ensure swarm manager is run in auto-lock mode

7.7.desc: Ensure swarm manager auto-lock key is rotated periodically

7.8.desc: Ensure node certificates are rotated as appropriate

7.9.desc: Ensure CA certificates are rotated as appropriate

7.10.desc: Ensure management plane traffic has been separated from data plane traffic
